aircraft.value: Chimera Multi - AC-2872-719 at Maintenance Hub-Y

defect_observed.value: Pneumatic starter motor overheat. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.

root_cause.value: Software algorithm error in control logic implementation

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pressurization component. Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.

corrective_action.value: Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications

remarks_investigation.value: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.

remarks_design.value: Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate. Date: 28/11/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit. Date: 30/11/2024 Signature: Dr. A.K. Sharma

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations. Date: 30/11/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur. Date: 03/12/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr D.S. Nair

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound. Date: 07/12/2024 Signature: Gp Capt N.R. Kumar

a) Root Cause Analysis: Software algorithm error in control logic implementation
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pressurization component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Adjust calibration settings to manufacturer specifications

ii. Preventive Action: Conduct fleet-wide inspection campaign
